 Mohamed Sharief  
Senior  Security Consultant  
 
 
 
 
PERSONAL SUMMARY  
 
A Technical Consultant with extensive knowledge in Cyber Security/Network Security 
domains and more than 8  years of experience in IT industry.  
 
 
 
EDUCATION  
 
B.sc (Honours) in Telecommunication s Engineering Tech nology from Future 
University - February  2011.  
 
 
CERTIFICATIONS:  
 
 LogRhythm Deployment Engineer LRDE.  
 Certified Ethical Hacker (CEHv9 ) 
 Palo Alto Certified Network Security Consultant (PCNSC)  
 Palo Alto Certified Network Security Engineer (PCNSE7)

 Cisco Certified Network  Associate (CCNA Secu rity)

 VMware Certified Professional – Network Virtualization (VCP -NV) 
 Trend Micro Advanced User Protection.  
 Trend Micro Advanced Network Defence (ATP).  
 Certified Information Systems Security Profes sional  (CISSP ) – In Progress  
 
 
WORK EXPERIENCE   
 
Mideast Data Systems (MDS) – Abu Dhabi, UAE  
 
Sr. Security  Consultant July 2019 – Present  
 
Duties :  
 Ability to  drive complex deployments while working side by side with the customers to 
resolve their unique problems.  
 Perform remote and on -site customization, installation, integration, and training of the 
solutions.  
 Responsible of implementing the following produc ts; Palo Alto NGFW & 
TRAPS/Cortex XDR & Prisma, FortiGate, FortiClient & FortiSandbox, LogRhythm, 
Infoblox, FireEye Network Security & Endpoint Security,  Symantec EDR & Endpoint 
Protection,  Vectra  AI, Trend Micro Apex  One, Deep Security & TippingPoint, Cen trify, 
MobileIron, EclecticIQ, SpyCloud,  Digital Shadows  & Ixia . 
 Present technical material in a clear, organized briefing to a mix of technical and non -
technical personnel . 
 Provide configurations, troubleshooting and best practices to customers.  
 Provide f ault isolation and root cause analysis for technical issues.  
 Continuously improve knowledge of current and emerging IT Security threats, 
vulnerabilities, their detection and mitigation.  
 PROFESSIONAL  
 
 
 
PERSONAL DETAILS  
 
Mohamed Sharief  
Abu Dhabi, UAE  
 
M: +971 565344959  
E: m.hussein1985@gmail.com  
 
Nationality: Sudanese  
Language : Arabic & English  
Visa Status:  Employment  Visa

IPv4&6 .

             CV Sharief - PS Consultant2020.docx             
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  StarLink – Trusted Security Advisor  – Dubai, UAE  
 
Professional Services Consultant Feb 2016 – July 2019  
Duties :  
 Cohesively work with other service and product team members to find creative 
solutions to our customers’ challenges.  
 Perform remote and on -site customization, installation, integration, and training of 
the solutions.  
 Provide consulting to customers durin g the testing, evaluation, pilot, production and 
training phases to ensure a successful deployment.  
 Responsible of implementing the follow ing products; Palo Alto NGFW & 
Advanced Endpoint Solution TRAPS  & Cylance , LogRhythm , Mobile Iron 
MDM , Arbor , Symantec ProxySG  & PacketShaper  and Infoblox . 
 Present technical material in a clear, organized briefing to a mix of technical and 
non-technical personnel . 
 Provide configurations, troubleshooting and best practices to customers.  
 Provide fault isolation and root cause analysis for technical issues.  
 Continuously improve knowledge of current and emerging IT Security threats, 
vulnerabilities, their detection and mitigation.  
 
Emaratech FZ LLC  – Dubai, UAE  
Technical Support Engineer April 2014 – Jan 2016   
Projects:  
Vision Immigration System at Dubai Airport T2&T3  
NGE System for Emirates Airlines at T3  
 
Ministry of Electricity & Dams  - Sudan  
Network & Security Administrator  March 2011 – Feb 2014  
 Duties :  
 
 Manages network operations to include  troubleshooting connectivity problems; 
installing & maintaining routers, firewalls and switches; adding/terminating 
Access Points ; Performs routine preventive maintenance on hardware and 
software.  
 Familiar with Cisco Routers 1700s/1800s/2600s/3700s, Cisco  Switches 1900, 
2950, 3550, 3750, 4500, 6500; NetGear and 3Com Routers  & Switches . 
 Strong hands on experience in configuring Cisco based routing e.g. RIP, EIGRP, 
IGRP, OSPF, route redistribution etc. Redundanc y protocols e.g. HSRP, VRRP. 
Switching e.g. VLAN implementation, STP, VTP , Access lists, L3 Switching 
and other technologies e.g. DNS, DHCP, S ub-netting, VLANs, Wi -Fi, VPN, 
Ether Channels , IDS/IPS, IPv6 and  OSI Network Model overall .  
 
KEY SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES  
 
 Quick learner with ability to grasp new technologies, both software and hardware. 
Proven ability to work under pressure and team environment. Fluent in English, 
reading, speaking and writing. Willing to relocate.  
 
TRAINING   
 Trend Micro Advanced – User Protection.  
 LogRhythm Installation and Deployment 7.2  
 ITIL v3 Foundation.   
 IBM QRadar Advanced Technical Training.  
 VMware NSX Design & Deploy 6.2  
 Palo Alto Networks CSL Training.  
 Infoblox DDI Training.
